## fcn() function

Use a function created via `defineFunction` to handle the custom query/mutation/subscription. In your function handler, you can use the `Schema["YOUR_QUERY_OR_MUTATION_NAME"]["functionHandler"]` utility type to type the handler function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function fcn(fn: FunctionHandlerData): FunctionHandler;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

fn


</td><td>

[FunctionHandlerData](./data-schema.functionhandlerdata.md)


</td><td>

A function created via `defineFunction`<!-- -->. Alternatively, you can pass in a "string" of the function name and pass in a corresponding value into the `functionMap` property of defineData.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[FunctionHandler](./data-schema.functionhandler.md)

A handler for the query / mutation / subscription

## Example

import { type ClientSchema, a, defineData, defineFunction // 1.Import "defineFunction" to create new functions } from '<!-- -->@<!-- -->aws-amplify/backend';

// 2. define a function const echoHandler = defineFunction(<!-- -->{ entry: './echo-handler/handler.ts' }<!-- -->)

const schema = a.schema(<!-- -->{ EchoResponse: a.customType(<!-- -->{ content: a.string(), executionDuration: a.float() }<!-- -->),

echo: a .query() .arguments(<!-- -->{ content: a.string() }<!-- -->) .returns(a.ref('EchoResponse')) .authorization(allow =<!-- -->&gt; \[allow.publicApiKey()\]) // 3. set the function has the handler .handler(a.handler.function(echoHandler)) }<!-- -->);
